verses.roman:
tato vyamuñcad yamunāṁ
yācito bhagavān balaḥ
vijagāha jalaṁ strībhiḥ
kareṇubhir ivebha-rāṭ

synonyms: tataḥ—then; vyamuñcat—released; yamunām—the Yamunā; yācitaḥ—begged; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; balaḥ—Balarāma; vijagāha—He submerged Himself; jalam—in the water; strībhiḥ—with the women; kareṇubhiḥ—with his she-elephants; iva—as; ibha—of elephants; rāṭ—the king.
translation: [Śukadeva Gosvāmī continued:] Thereupon Lord Balarāma released the Yamunā and, like the king of the elephants with his entourage of she-elephants, entered the river's water with His female companions.
